about.name: Katherine Winter
about.title: Software Engineering Manager
about.desc: I am constantly trying to organize and improve the world around me. I’m determined, passionate, hardworking with unyielding self-motivation. Known for leadership skills, efficiency, and work ethic.

boxes.name: Full Sail University
boxes.title: Education
boxes.desc: Bachelor of Science in Game Development - Full Sail University 2010, Winter Park, FL

boxes.name: Orlando Sentinel
boxes.title: Electronic Arts summer camp helps grow girls' interest in creating video games

boxes.name: Femmhack
boxes.title: EA: Recruiting Events
boxes.desc: Created interview questions and conducted interviews for Software Engineer Interns-3. Recruitted at Grace Hopper Celebration (Texas and Orlando) and Femmhack (Philadelphia)

boxes.name: EA: Womens ERG
boxes.title: Culture and Gaming lead
boxes.desc: Ran EA culture events that promoted retention and morale.

boxes.name: Mentorship
boxes.title: EA && Girls Who Code && Get In The Game
boxes.desc: Mentored junior engineers and set up actionable goals for engineers to progress in their careers.

boxes.name: Software Engineering Manager
boxes.title: Poll Everywhere
desc2: Responsible for planning projects to address business goals in quarterly work plan.
Manager for three software engineers. Conducted one on ones and mentored them on career growth.
Created reports and metrics on how our systems were performing in the wild.
Enhanced development process for controlling quality and remain 'release ready'.

boxes.name: System Engineer
boxes.title: Frostbite, EA
desc2: Responsible for and created engineer development process. Resulted in the team delivering higher quality work and happier customers measured by NPS.
Gave presentations at internal EA conferences on performance metric tracking & development process
Created technology used across all Frostbite titles. Two pass layout system, multiline text input, etc
Provided engineering support for game team engineers. Harvest back game team additions to engine and finalized the features.
Responsible for writing and reviewing detailed technical documentation and technical designs.
Responsible for reviewing game team divergences, documenting, and creating scalable solutions.

boxes.name: Software Engineer
boxes.title: Origin, EA
desc2: Worked closely with creative/design team to transform raw artwork/wireframes into code representations with pixel-perfect accuracy. Enforced UI design and practices.
Feature owner for majority of Origin desktop client UI. (All except store, profile, and chat)
Worked in large, distributed development team. Lead and mentored junior engineers.

boxes.name: Software Engineer
boxes.title: Total Immersion Software
desc2: Designed and constructed multiple tools for design team to create new content. C#/C++/SWIG

boxes.name: Software Engineer – Consultant
boxes.title: Chug
desc2: Created website data remapping tool designed to analyze marketing data, developed in C++ and C#.
Created database and website to display market data: ApacheHTML, PHP, MySQL, and JavaScript.

boxes.name: Software Engineer
boxes.title: Full Sail University - Ginger Dead
desc2: 3D survival defense game using C++, DirectX, Lua, and Wwise.
Team consists of 11 people: 1 Internal Producer, 8 Engineers, and 2 Artists.
Responsible for instancing animation by utilizing D3DX's animation support. Loaded in character and enemy attributes using Lua.
Project lead for special effects.

boxes.name: Software Engineer
boxes.title: Side Project - Kerned Font / Bound Box Editor
desc2: C# tool
Used for creating bounding boxes on an image. Reads and writes files.

boxes.name: Design & AI Lead, Gameplay engineer
boxes.title: Painter's Nightmare
desc2: 2D Real Time Strategy game. Developed by a team of four engineers, over a two-month timeframe using C++.
Made mini-map, unit editor (C# tool), AI (unit & enemy decision making - state machine), design doc authoritarian.
Received award 'Best Game in Show' - Dustin Clingman, CEO at IMI Labs, LLC.

boxes.name: Software Engineer
boxes.title: Star Bound
desc2: 2D tower climber. Created over a one-month timeframe using C++.
Reimaged from flash game off newgrounds.com
Received 4th place award in class competition for best game out of 30+ students

boxes.name: Team development
boxes.title: Frostbite, EA
desc2: Responsible for and created engineer development process. Resulted in the team delivering higher quality work and happier customers measured by NPS.
Gave presentations at internal EA conferences on performance metric tracking & development process
Created technology used across all Frostbite titles. Two pass layout system, multiline text input, etc
Provided engineering support for game team engineers. Harvest back game team additions to engine and finalized the features.
Responsible for writing and reviewing detailed technical documentation and technical designs.
Responsible for reviewing game team divergences, documenting, and creating scalable solutions.
